name: DacPacReport
description: Provides a report on database model changes. You can compare your DACPAC with DACPAC's from previous builds or with sql server databases. This task is an improvement of the task created by Colin Dembovsky (colinsalmcorner.com)
author: Dennes Torres (dennestorres.com) and Colin Dembovsky (colinsalmcorner.com)

groups.name: notdrop
groups.displayName: Do not Drop these missing items

inputs.name: dropName
inputs.label: Drop Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the drop in which to find previous build dacpac file.

inputs.name: dacpacName
inputs.label: DacPac Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the dacpac (without .dacpac extension) to run the schema compare on.

inputs.name: targetDacPacPath
inputs.label: Compiled DacPac Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to find the target dacpac (typically the artifact staging path where the dacpac will be uploaded from).

inputs.name: servername
inputs.label: SQL Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: SQL Server name, including port if not default, using the format <server>,<port>

inputs.name: databasename
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the database target of the comparison

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: User name for the SQL Server connection

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the SQL Server connection

inputs.name: integratedsecurity
inputs.label: Integrated Security
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this to use integrated security to SQL Server

inputs.name: extraArgs
inputs.label: Extra SQLPackage args
inputs.helpMarkDown: Extra args to use for running the SQLPackage.exe schema compare command.

inputs.name: reverse
inputs.label: Reverse Comparison
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this to reverse the source and target.

inputs.name: database
inputs.label: Database Comparison
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this to make a comparison with a database server, instead of the previous build

inputs.name: ignorepermissions
inputs.label: Ignore Permissions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Ignore permissions differences during comparison

inputs.name: ignoreauthorizer
inputs.label: Ignore the Authorizer
inputs.helpMarkDown: Ignore owner (Authorizer) of the object, in special schemas

inputs.name: ignorerolemembership
inputs.label: Ignore Role Membership
inputs.helpMarkDown: Ignore Role Membership during comparison

inputs.name: notapplicationroles
inputs.label: Do not drop application roles
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't drop existing application roles

inputs.name: notdatabaseroles
inputs.label: Don't drop existing database roles
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't drop existing database roles

inputs.name: notdefaults
inputs.label: Do not drop defaults
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't drop existing default objects. Keep in mind most developers forget to name default objects and unamed default objects will be considered different

inputs.name: notlogins
inputs.label: Don't drop existing logins
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't drop existing logins

inputs.name: notserverrolemembership
inputs.label: Don't drop server role membership
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't drop existing server roles membership

inputs.name: notusers
inputs.label: Don't drop database users
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't drop existing database users

inputs.name: userSqlPackagePath
inputs.label: SQL Package exe filepath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the sqlpackage.exe filepath - use this only if the default does not detect the path correctly.
